segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, lost in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But how can she not notice the water pouring out of the sink?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s such a mess, and the cabinets will surely be damaged if she doesn’t catch it soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a mix of frustration and disbelief; it’s like she’s in a bubble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Can she really be that oblivious to the chaos happening around her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that plate, as if everything else could fall apart and she wouldn’t care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s all so careless, and I can’t shake off the feeling that something bad will happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
